[]Author: Ionel Roman;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
A strategic location from where you have quick access to many attractions of Rome with cozy clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff and tasteful breakfast. We stayed here for 3 nights and had no problems, our room was cleaned every day, the breakfast was fresh and plentiful (not a lot of different things but enough for every taste) and the staff was very polite (from the reception to the cleaning and the kitchen). We also had an excellent spa day in the hotel with clean dry sauna, jacuzzi and hot steam Turkish bath.

Author: massimo mancusi;
Rating: 5
When: 2 months ago
60mt from the trevi fountain best location

Author: Mel Levi;
Rating: 4
When: a year ago
We stayed 5 nights from Nov 9-14th. Very pleased with the hotel. GREAT location. Nice rooms and breakfast. Staff is wonderful and very helpful. First night we were put in a small room as hotel was at 100% occupancy. They moved us to a very nice room for nights 2-5. Would certainly stay there again and recommend.

Author: Giovanna Gravina;
Rating: 1
When: a year ago
Terrible experience! dirty rooms with cigarette smells! bad breakfast with few options. I definitely don't recommend it. I think they disregard the whole because they are in a good location. Not to mention the time we arrived in the room, with cigarette butts in the toilet and sheets and room stinking of cigarettes. We just didn't change hotels because it was time to go back to our country. Not sure how it fits into a 3 star hotel.

Author: Erin G;
Rating: 3
When: a year ago
Three stars based on convenience and location. I always keep an open mind when traveling abroad, and when staying in bigger cities I expect to pay more for a hotel room. This hotel is definitely on the pricier side. However, I wasn‚Äôt in Rome to hang out in a hotel room. It was a place to sleep and served its purpose. Pros: Convenience and location. It‚Äôs around the corner from the Trivi Fountain, walking distance to all the touristy spots and easy to find. Complimentary breakfast and nice kitchen staff. They were kind enough to let me borrow a wine opener, and in no hurry to have me return it. Hot tea in the lobby...sometimes. Cons: This wasn‚Äôt the cleanest hotel. The rooms and restrooms weren‚Äôt the cleanest. Over priced and very loud. You can hear people talking in the hallways and in the other rooms. Looks like they are remodeling. Bottom Line: If this hotel did a better job cleaning the hotel rooms and restrooms I would stay here again.

[]Author: Jhon Henry Morales;
Rating: 5
When: a week ago
When someone who's a foodie gives a 5 star review, this better be Bobby Flay like cuisine. Listen closely, it hits the mark hands down. There's not a dish I haven't devoured nor a waiter who wasn't attentive. Owners are stellar and deserve the accolades. This isn't by accident, it's by design.

Author: Adam Gy√∂khegyi;
Rating: 5
When: 8 months ago
A beautiful sight with an amazing array of sculptures! A true gem, great spot to take a break for some ice cream. Once again, restrictions offer a strange contrast: it's amazing to actually see everything and keep a distance, but it just doesn't have the same atmosphere.

Author: Denisa Miruna;
Rating: 5
When: 8 months ago
Such a beautiful place to see in Rome üòç one of the most known attractions in the city and trust me it‚Äôs worth it! The fountain has a beautiful structure and the details are just amazing. In my opinion it looks much better in reality than in pictures so I would highly recommend to visit this place if you come to Rome!

Rating: 5
When: 5 months ago
Yeah I know it's crowded...get over it. When you first round the corner and see how majestic and beautiful this fountain is you will soon forget about the crowds and will find yourself making your way to waters edge. Try to take a second and make out every sculpture and the beauty of the craftsman ship; it's truly breathtaking. Also make sure to go back at night!!

[]Author: Abdul Hakam;
Rating: 4
When: 3 years ago
There are around 130 museums in Paris, France within city limits. This list also includes suburban museums within the "Grand Paris" area, such as the Air and Space Museum. The sixteen museums of the City of Paris are annotated with "VP", as well as six other ones also accommodated in municipal premises

[]Author: Daniel K Elkin;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
Small group tours of the De Chirico house with English and Italian language guidance. The house is full of the artist‚Äôs original furniture and collected works from multiple periods in his life. Guides are friendly and knowledgeable. Pre-booking is required for 7 Euro. Since there isn‚Äôt much else to do near the Spanish steps (other than shop and eat at overpriced restaurants) this museum is an easy one-hour activity and well, well worth it.

Author: Joash Jesurun Alfred Jeevaranjan;
Rating: 3
When: a year ago
he Giorgio de Chirico House Museum (Casa Museo di Giorgio de Chirico) is a house museum in the 16th century Palazzetto del Borgognoni at Piazza di Spagna 31 in Rome. The house was acquired by Giorgio de Chirico in 1948. It was left to the state by his widow and opened as a museum in 1998. Only open by appointment, it is closed on Mondays and Sundays. The nearest Metro stop is Spagna.

Author: Tracey Eve Winton;
Rating: 5
When: 2 years ago
If you‚Äôre interested in Giorgio de Chirico, to visit his home and studio is highly recommended. You must reserve in advance online. Tours last an hour and are available in English and Italian, but only certain hours and days.

Author: Erik Nye;
Rating: 5
When: 2 years ago
Wow, I was pretty blown away by De Chirico‚Äôs home and studio, which is filled with his art and overlooks both Spagna and Villa Medici. Book intimate group tours in advance on their website.

Author: Asiyah Noemi Koso;
Rating: 5
When: 8 months ago
We love to come to Piazza di Spagna. It is always a good atmosphere, one of the most popular Roman gatherings and one of the most beautiful Roman squares. The long stairs, the obelisk, church on the hill and the interesting Bernini fountain make this square unique in the world. At Spanish Steps is always a good atmosphere, always with lots of cheerful young people. Above Spanish Steps is the beautiful church of Trinit√† dei Monti. In front of the church is the obelisk in the glory of the Immaculate Conception which was created as a compromise between the Papal States and France,who wanted to erect a monument to King Louis XIV. Also interesting is the Fontana della Barcaccia, was made in memory of a flood of the Tiber in the late 16th century, when at that place, after the withdrawal of water, remained stranded boat. It's certainly a must-see on any walking trip around Rome.

The Baroque Fontana della Barcaccia (which means useless old boat) was designed by famous Bernini family. The boat lies half submerged in a shallow pool. Pay attention to the bow of the ship where the coat of arms of Pope Urban VIII Barberini ( with three lovely bees) is located.

It is also out of the most common touristic tours even if it's at walking distance from places like piazza di spagna, etc.

Author: Yi-fan Cai;
Rating: 5
When: 2 years ago
Open to public once a year on Republican day of Italy. You have to queue for more than an hour (some said three) but it's totally worthy. The garden is beautiful and well maintained, but the best part this day is live concert by military and police bands. You have no better chance to enjoy popular classic music with all Italians and celebrate the day with them.

Author: cerys Davies;
Rating: 4
When: a year ago
It was interesting. Cant say it's for the general non italian speaking tourist, but if you can make up your own version of what's being said or be organised and google an english brief paragraph of the rooms so you understand what the significance of the room is, then great. Some of the rooms have got a wow factor. And there is a particular chandelier that's...interesting. Not for the faint of heart. We did the long tour and it did feel like it dragged at some points. We were on a tour with school teenagers and glad to see that they were just as riveted as us. The tour guide from his vigorous hand and facial expressions exuded passion and knowledge so as long as you can understand him, it's perfect.

[]Author: ajay kumar;

It is small park with benches. No swings or other play things for kids. Trevi Fountain is just 7 minutes walk.

Author: Stanley Mo;
Rating: 5
When: 7 months ago
Very quiet in the morning, just a few dog walkers. A pleasant green area in a city with relatively little grass or gardens. I used it for a peaceful morning training session, then strolled back to the hotel past the polizia, who must have thought I was nuts.

Rating: 5

Author: Tony Price;
Rating: 1

Author: Kuala Bound;
Rating: 1
When: 9 months ago
Once you reach the place you wait for your hour booked to be called to enter. Inside a staff assistant will lead the 8 customers and check they will move to the following room after the maximum time of 5 minutes spent in the previous. So it is better to study Raffaello works before the exhibit and any time you enter a room it is better TO FOCUS AND GO STRAIGHT TO THE OBJECTS YOU PREFER and then if there is time left look the rest. Lighting is terrible. Sometimes too many reflexes, other so poor lit you cannot see. Terrace is shut so you will miss the spectacular view from it.

[]Author: ajay kumar;
Rating: 5
When: a month ago
A very big villa. A very good place to spend time with kids. Tricycles are available on rent. There is a zoo on the one side of the Villa. In addition, there is boating facility. So, families can enjoy the whole day here.

Author: Hugo Lessing;
Rating: 4
When: 9 months ago
This park must be one of the best on the planet. Sadly, due to the people I was with I had to go to the modern art museum which wasn't personally for me. But the lakes/ponds here are very pleasant and have turtles in them. Also the structures and gardens are great.

Author: Shelby Elkins;
Rating: 5
When: 7 months ago
I love Villa Borghese park! It has amazing views of Rome, is huge, and completely free! Take a walk, ride/rent a bike, have a picnic - you can do anything here! They even have food trucks, small restaurants, small carnival rides for children, fountains, etc. You can fill your bottle up for free from the water spouts, look out over rome, and even leave by walking down the Spanish Steps. Highly recommend!

Author: Jonno Cutts;
Rating: 5
When: 7 months ago
Nice escape in the city, we scooted around on the electric scooters for a great time and a good laugh

Author: Bogdan Criveanu;
Rating: 5
When: 7 months ago
One of the must-see in Rome

[]Author: Ionel Roman;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
A strategic location from where you have quick access to many attractions of Rome with cozy clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff and tasteful breakfast. We stayed here for 3 nights and had no problems, our room was cleaned every day, the breakfast was fresh and plentiful (not a lot of different things but enough for every taste) and the staff was very polite (from the reception to the cleaning and the kitchen). We also had an excellent spa day in the hotel with clean dry sauna, jacuzzi and hot steam Turkish bath.

Author: massimo mancusi;
Rating: 5
When: 2 months ago
60mt from the trevi fountain best location

Author: Mel Levi;
Rating: 4
When: a year ago
We stayed 5 nights from Nov 9-14th. Very pleased with the hotel. GREAT location. Nice rooms and breakfast. Staff is wonderful and very helpful. First night we were put in a small room as hotel was at 100% occupancy. They moved us to a very nice room for nights 2-5. Would certainly stay there again and recommend.

Author: Giovanna Gravina;
Rating: 1
When: a year ago
Terrible experience! dirty rooms with cigarette smells! bad breakfast with few options. I definitely don't recommend it. I think they disregard the whole because they are in a good location. Not to mention the time we arrived in the room, with cigarette butts in the toilet and sheets and room stinking of cigarettes. We just didn't change hotels because it was time to go back to our country. Not sure how it fits into a 3 star hotel.

Author: Erin G;
Rating: 3
When: a year ago
Three stars based on convenience and location. I always keep an open mind when traveling abroad, and when staying in bigger cities I expect to pay more for a hotel room. This hotel is definitely on the pricier side. However, I wasn‚Äôt in Rome to hang out in a hotel room. It was a place to sleep and served its purpose. Pros: Convenience and location. It‚Äôs around the corner from the Trivi Fountain, walking distance to all the touristy spots and easy to find. Complimentary breakfast and nice kitchen staff. They were kind enough to let me borrow a wine opener, and in no hurry to have me return it. Hot tea in the lobby...sometimes. Cons: This wasn‚Äôt the cleanest hotel. The rooms and restrooms weren‚Äôt the cleanest. Over priced and very loud. You can hear people talking in the hallways and in the other rooms. Looks like they are remodeling. Bottom Line: If this hotel did a better job cleaning the hotel rooms and restrooms I would stay here again.
